title: A hierarchical and scalable model for contemporary document image segmentation
abstract: In this paper, we introduce a novel color segmentation approach robust against digitization noise and adapted to contemporary document images. This system is scalable, hierarchical, versatile and completely automated, i.e. user independent. It proposes an adaptive binarization/quantization without any penalizing information loss. This model may be used for many purposes. For instance, we rely on it to carry out the first steps leading to advertisement recognition in document images. Furthermore, the color segmentation output is used to localize text areas and enhance optical character recognition (OCR) performances. We held tests on a variety of magazine images to point up our contribution to the well-known OCR product Abby FinerReader. We also get promising results with our ad detection system on a large set of complex layout testing images.
